name: Catch a Coke
description:
Playable 3D simulation of this   classic handheld electronic game including views of the original packaging and instruction guide . A RetroFab simulation Version 0.9.7 Details Title Catch a Coke Manufacturer Bandai Electronics Series Game Digital (GD) Series Screen Liquid Crystal Display ( LCD ) Release Date 1983 Description

Catch a Coke, licensed by Coca-Cola and produced by Bandai Electronics, is a very rare handheld electronic game that was never sold to the public but was instead given away as a promotional item to Coca-Cola sales reps as an incentive for selling their products.

Gameplay

In Catch a Coke the player must move a Coca-Cola salesman left and right to catch cans of coke being thrown by a monkey.

There are two game modes available. In Game 1, the Monkey starts by throwing only one coke at a time. Then he begins throwing two at a time, then three at a time, and finally, a challenging four at a time. In Game 2, the number of cokes thrown by the monkey will vary from 1 to 4 as will the speed.

When you miss a coke, the ground directly below the coke will disappear. If you miss another coke in the same place, the game is over!

Trivia

Catch a Coke is actually a re-release of Bandai's 1981 handheld electronic game, Monkey Coconut, with the exact same gameplay except you have to catch cans of coke instead of coconuts.

Controls Keyboard Game 1 F1 Game 2 F2 Mode Select F5 Left A or Left Arrow Right D or Right Arrow Mouse Rotate Drag Press Left-click Zoom Mousewheel Resources Audio Showagamer ( youtube.com ) Box Art Rik Morgan ( handheldmuseum.com ) Instructions Daniel Hausmann ( bandai-game-digital.com )
